csuite.title: Chief administrative officer
csuite.role: A top-tier executive who supervises the daily operations of a business and is ultimately responsible for its performance

csuite.title: Chief analytics officer
csuite.role: The senior manager responsible for the analysis of data within an organization

csuite.title: Chief brand officer
csuite.role: Officer responsible for a brand's image, experience, and promise

csuite.title: Chief business development officer
csuite.role: Identifies new opportunities for the corporation and develops strategies to pursue those opportunities

csuite.title: Chief business officer
csuite.role: A position that allocates a company’s resources to meet strategic and financial goals.

csuite.title: Chief commercial officer
csuite.role: Officer responsible for the commercial strategy and the development of an organization

csuite.title: Chief communications officer
csuite.role: The head of communications, public relations, and public affairs in an organization

csuite.title: Chief compliance officer
csuite.role: Person primarily responsible for overseeing and managing regulatory compliance issues within an organization

csuite.title: Chief content officer
csuite.role: Responsible for the digital media creation and multi-channel publication of the organization's content (text, video, audio, animation, etc.)

csuite.title: Chief creative officer
csuite.role: Officer who directs a company's creative output, developing the artistic design strategy that defines the company's brand

csuite.title: Chief customer officer
csuite.role: Responsible in customer-centric companies for the total relationship with an organization’s customers

csuite.title: Chief data officer
csuite.role: Responsible for enterprise-wide governance and utilization of information as an asset, via data processing, analysis, data mining, information trading and other means

csuite.title: Chief design officer
csuite.role: Typically responsible for overseeing all design and innovation aspects of a company's products and services, including product design, graphic design, user experience design, industrial design, and package design

csuite.title: Chief digital officer
csuite.role: An individual who helps an organization drive growth by converting "analog" businesses to digital ones using the potential of modern online technologies and data (i.e., digital transformation), and at times oversees operations in digital sectors like mobile applications, social media and related applications, virtual goods, as well as web-based information management and marketing

csuite.title: Chief diversity officer
csuite.role: An organization’s executive-level diversity and inclusion strategist

csuite.title: Chief executive officer
csuite.role: The most senior corporate, executive, or administrative officer in charge of managing an organization

csuite.title: Chief experience officer
csuite.role: Executive responsible for the overall experience of an organization's products and services

csuite.title: Chief financial officer
csuite.role: Primarily responsible for managing the company's finances, including financial planning, management of financial risks, record-keeping, and financial reporting

csuite.title: Chief gaming officer
csuite.role: Executive in charge of heading both the game development and the online and offline publishing functions of a company

csuite.title: Chief genealogical officer
csuite.role: Maintains the genealogical integrity of an organization

csuite.title: Chief growth officer
csuite.role: Identifies areas where the company can grow, measured in revenue, or user/subscriber base or equivalent

csuite.title: Chief human resources officer
csuite.role: A corporate officer who oversees all aspects of human resource management and industrial relations policies, practices, and operations for an organization

csuite.title: Chief information officer
csuite.role: Alongside the CTO, often the most senior executive in an enterprise who works with information technology and computer systems, in order to support enterprise goals. Generally they focus on the internal technology requirements, leaving strategy, product and customer-facing issues with the CTO.

csuite.title: Chief information officer (higher education)
csuite.role: The senior executive who is responsible for information and communications technology in the university, college or other higher education institution

csuite.title: Chief information security officer
csuite.role: The senior-level executive within an organization responsible for establishing and maintaining the enterprise vision, strategy, and program to ensure information assets and technologies are adequately protected

csuite.title: Chief innovation officer
csuite.role: A person in a company who is primarily responsible for managing the process of innovation and change management in an organization, as well as being in some cases the person who "originates new ideas but also recognizes innovative ideas generated by other people"

csuite.title: Chief quality officer
csuite.role: A person in charge to oversee and manage all aspects of quality within the organization to ensure that products, services, and processes meet or exceed established quality standards and customer expectations. This person plays a critical role in fostering a culture of quality and ensuring that the organization delivers products and services that meet high standards of excellence.

csuite.title: Chief investment officer
csuite.role: The one whose purpose is to understand, manage, and monitor their organization's portfolio of assets, devise strategies for growth, act as the liaison with investors, and recognize and avoid serious risks, including those never before encountered

csuite.title: Chief knowledge officer
csuite.role: Officer responsible for managing intellectual capital and the custodian of knowledge management practices in an organization

csuite.title: Chief learning officer
csuite.role: The person in charge of learning management, be it corporate or personal training

csuite.title: Chief legal officer
csuite.role: The officer in charge of all an organization’s legal affairs

csuite.title: Chief marketing officer
csuite.role: Corporate executive responsible for marketing activities in an organization

csuite.title: Chief operating officer
csuite.role: The COO is responsible for the daily operation of a company

csuite.title: Chief people officer
csuite.role: Person in charge of every aspect of the employee life cycle in an organization

csuite.title: Chief privacy officer
csuite.role: Officer responsible for managing risks related to information privacy laws and regulations

csuite.title: Chief process officer
csuite.role: An executive responsible for business process management at the highest level of an organization

csuite.title: Chief product officer
csuite.role: An executive responsible for various product-related activities in an organization

csuite.title: Chief reputation officer
csuite.role: A CRO is responsible for reputation, brand, public relations and public affairs

csuite.title: Chief research officer
csuite.role: Officer responsible for research that supports enterprise goals

csuite.title: Chief restructuring officer
csuite.role: A senior officer of a company given broad powers to renegotiate all aspects of a company’s finances to deal with an impending bankruptcy or to restructure a company following a bankruptcy filing

csuite.title: Chief revenue officer
csuite.role: A corporate officer responsible for all revenue generation processes in an organization

csuite.title: Chief risk officer
csuite.role: The executive accountable for enabling the efficient and effective governance of significant risks, and related opportunities, to a business and its various segments. Risks are commonly categorized as strategic, reputational, operational, financial, or compliance-related.

csuite.title: Chief scientific officer
csuite.role: A position at the head of scientific research operations at an organizations or company performing significant scientific research projects

csuite.title: Chief security officer
csuite.role: Senior executive accountable for the development and oversight of compliance, operational, strategic, financial and reputation security risk policies and programs intended for the mitigation and reduction of strategies relating to the protection of people, intellectual assets and tangible property

csuite.title: Chief services officer
csuite.role: Responsible for developing processes and tools, both internally and externally, for producing maximum value to all stakeholders with intelligent and efficient use of potentially fluctuating human resources

csuite.title: Chief solutions officer
csuite.role: Executive responsible for the identification, development and delivery of business solutions and services

csuite.title: Chief strategy officer
csuite.role: Responsible for developing strategy, managing the strategic planning process, and optimizing the corporate portfolio through M&A and divestitures

csuite.title: Chief supply chain officer
csuite.role: Involves the movement and storage of raw materials, of work–in–progress inventory, and of finished goods from point of origin to point of consumption

csuite.title: Chief sustainability officer
csuite.role: Corporate executive in charge of a corporation's "environmental" programmes

csuite.title: Chief technical officer
csuite.role: A variation of chief technology officer

csuite.title: Chief technology officer
csuite.role: CTOs make decisions for the overarching technology infrastructure that closely align with an organization's goals, and tend to be more focused on strategic and customer facing or product issues. While CIOs focus more on internal infrastructure of a company and work alongside an organization's IT staff members to perform everyday operations.

csuite.title: Chief technology security officer
csuite.role: The senior-level executive within an organization responsible for establishing and maintaining the enterprise security technical vision, controls, and program to ensure information assets and technologies are adequately protected. Some organizations have both a CISO and a CTSO.

csuite.title: Chief visibility officer
csuite.role: An individual appointed to oversee all aspects of performance across retail stores, corporations or organizations

csuite.title: Chief visionary officer
csuite.role: Officer responsible of creating a forward vision for a company

csuite.title: Chief web officer
csuite.role: Person in charge of an organisation's Internet presence, including all Internet and intranet sites
